page.title: 04NATURAL HISTORY IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The varied geology of the area, with hills and valleys, allows for a rich local ecology. Since farming and forestry are the dominant features of the landscape it is not surprising that many local people are interested in natural history. There is a splendid variety of wild flowers along the road and lane verges, and a wide range of birds. All types of indigenous Hawks and Owls are present. Some like Curlews and Plovers arrive in Spring, Woodcock and Crossbills are residents. All of the smaller mammals, except deer and wildcat, are present, but seldom seen in daytime. Bats, lizards, snakes, frogs and toads are seen in the spring and summer months.
